info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 7:33PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Catawba, Lincoln, southeastern Iredell, north central Mecklenburg, western Rowan and northwestern Gaston Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 733 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles southwest of Lincolnton, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lincolnton, Statesville, Cornelius, Mooresville, Davidson, Cherryville, China Grove, Maiden, Westport and Troutman. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for the Piedmont of North Carolina.
